snippet: Officials pointed to materials the suspects stockpiled, including explosives; their Middle East travels; and evidence of contacts with people with Islamist extremist views.
abstract: Officials say Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik, couple who police say killed 14 people and wounded 21 in social services center in San Bernardino, Calif, had stockpiled thousands of rounds of ammunition and one dozen homemade pipe bombs in their home; FBI is handling shooting as potential terrorist act, although it is not conclusive.

byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and LAURIE GOODSTEIN
byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from San Bernardino, Laurie Goodstein and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Ian Lovett, Adam Nagourney, Julie Turkewitz and Rebecca Fairley Raney from San Bernardino; Marc Santora, Julia Preston, Benjamin Mueller, Ashley Southall, Christine Hauser, Jack Begg, Susan C. Beachy, Erik Eckholm and Timothy Williams from New York; Matt Apuzzo, Eric Schmitt and Kitty Bennett from Washington; and Jack Healy from Denver.

lead_paragraph: Officials pointed to materials the suspects stockpiled, including explosives; their Middle East travels; and evidence of contacts with people with Islamist extremist views.

headline.main: San Bernardino Suspects Left Trail of Clues, but No Clear Motive
headline.print_headline: Arms Stockpile Is Found in Home of Two Suspects
